intro: Guatteria alutacea f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub belonging to the family Marcaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential horticultural use.
